column4: My laptop's external cd-rom drive is conflicing with Ubuntu booting from the live cd. Is there anything I can do about this?
Ubuntu cannot mount the CD from my external cd-rom drive on my laptop. Is there anything I can do to fix this?
BrandonThe: It looks like you're having my same problem!
Lassegs: Not exactly. It looks like it had to do with my CD-rom drive the whole time.
For awhile I thought I fixed it.
Lassegs: Yes. My laptop doesn't have one built in.
Lassegs: Do you know if it's possible to download the distro on the computer and install it on that same system?
Is it possible to download Ubuntu and install it on the same system you downloaded it to?
of course, but you have to burn it to a cd of course
you can't boot from a usb device? my BIOS supports that...
so your computer is just a bunch of USB ports? :-p
Basically :-)
well there's got to be a way, but I wouldn't know, i'm not a boot master
check that the ISO has the right checksum
How do you check that?
under windows? i don't know google for md5 checksum
and then compare what it outputs to what it says on the download page
and you burned it as an iso not a file to the cd right?
Yes. It boots on another computer.
I think the checksum is fine, because it boots on another computer.
probably
